name: Empress Hotel of La Jolla

reviews.text: We rented room 506, a 1-BR suite and the only one with an ocean view (no balcony). We paid about $300 per night (fr, Sa, Su). This would just be an average hotel for La Jolla, a lower-cost competitor of the Grande Colonial.....if it wasn't for the staff. They are great, very helpful, and it makes the hotel. Breakfast on their rooftop deck was very nice, and valet parking was invcluded. We will stay again.
reviews.title: Great staff, good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ben and other staff members could not have been more helpful!
reviews.title: Great value!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is clean, very well located, and well priced. Many wonderful meals and cocktails within walking distance. Don't miss breakfast at the Cottage!
reviews.title: Perfect location and great experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach/shore is close enough to be convenient, but far enough to not be bothered by the traffic and noise.
reviews.title: Very Friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Empress for several days in June. Had a room at the back and it was wonderfully quiet. The king room was good sized with a sofa and a small table. Bed and linens were very good. Bathroom was well appointed with a great shower. We had valet parking and they were very quick to bring the car around. Breakfast is basic, but since we’re the granola and yogurt type it was fine for us. Coffee was very good. We found it very easy to walk everywhere we wanted in LaJolla from the Empress (Georges is about 10 minutes) and easy to get on the expressway to San Diego.
reviews.title: The Best Room in La Jolla

reviews.text: We blocked rooms at the Empress for our guests to our wedding in La Jolla. Somer, at Empress did a wonderful job of accomodating all of us and making sure everything went off without a hitch. We had around 30 guests in all staying at Empress over various number of days and didn't have one complaint from any of them. The rooms are definitely a little small in some cases, but for the price and the location, it's really hard to beat it in La Jolla. I'm sure there is always the exception and things do happening where everything doesn't go as planned, but I can say that we couldn't have asked for better service and truly enjoyed our visit. I think the fact that with 30 people there over 4 days, and no complaints, has to say something. We're looking forward to our next visit to La Jolla and to the Empress Hotel.
reviews.title: Outstanding visit and staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Totally agree that the hotel is well located for the very wide variety of places to eat and drink in La Jolla (the chap on reception gave us his tips on a map which was most useful). But we were allocated a room which was near the lifts and it was noisy - even with ear plugs - and surprisingly small for a US hotel. With hindsight we should have asked to be moved but we were too busy exploring La Jolla and the rest of San Diego which is truly wonderful. The breakfast isn't up to much either but there is a nice terrace so you can eat outside. Overall, we had a good deal on the room price (booked direct with the hotel) but this didn't make up for the disappointing room (if we stayed again we would be very careful about checking the room first). Oh, and good luck finding the hot tub....it's in a smal room in the basement!
reviews.title: OK if you can bag a decent room
Wanted to stay here..
reviews.text: After reading the reviews on trip advisor, we were ready to reserve our room. Went on the hotel's website and it showed they had a deluxe one king available for all 3 nights Thurs to Sat). I called the reservation line to check if they had any other specials than what was online and any other added fees. The man who answered the phone interrupted saying "I don't have anything on Sat., we are sold out for that night." I said "well the website shows there is availability." He quickly and abruptly said "what website are you on?" After informing him it was the hotel website he didn't even respond. I asked him "what would have happened if I booked it online and then got to the hotel and didn't have a room?" He said since I would have arrived on Thurs. I could probably keep my room but someone else wouldn't have a room because they were overbooked."

No apologies for the confusion or help from this man. Rude and poor customer service from this man. He could have cared less if I made a reservation. I wouldn't trust having a room ready for me if I booked it online. Needless to stay, we happily booked elsewhere. If the customer service is this bad from the start, who knows how bad it would be during the stay.
reviews.title: A Bit Overpriced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For the management of the hotel: This ignorant man did not give a name and I called at 8:30 pm central time on Monday night (8/24/09).
reviews.title: great location - utterly tastless

reviews.text: I found the Empress because I was so dissatisfied with the hotel in which I had spent the previous night. The night reception was very professional, showed me several rooms and quoted a very favortable rate.
reviews.title: A Well Preserved Dowager

reviews.text: The room was a suite with separate sitting room plus workspace plus wetbar with refrigerator. The bedroom was large with a jaccuzzi tub large enough for two, large bathroom with two sinks and large shower. The suite was very clean.
reviews.title: Warm, Friendly, Beautiful and Inviting - Just like La Jolla

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bed was soft, but a bed board was quickly installed.
reviews.title: Empress Met My Expectations

reviews.text: The staff was very attentive and helpful with directions and counsel about local sights in La Jolla. Parking was under the hotel and reasonably priced.
reviews.title: Booked 9 rooms for our parent's 50th anniversary and everyone was delighted with the Empress!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would return to the Empress without question.
reviews.title: Classic elegance with a modern touch

reviews.text: A friend/co-worker and I stayed for one night at this hotel. We were in town for a work conference. This hotel was in a great location and very comfortable. Nice rooms and comfy beds!
reviews.title: good location. nice hotel!
A nice stay and a great value
reviews.text: My wife and I traveled to La Jolla and the Empress Hotel for a bit of R & R and had a wonderful stay. The hotel is right on the edge of La Jolla Village so it is close to the action yet is nice and quiet at night. We really enjoyed the size of the room and the staff was very helpful and pleasant. While the rooms are older they have done a nice job of keeping them up and they are quite large. We look forward to staying at the Empress again in the future.

Each October I travel with my 5 friends and this year it was to La Jolla and the Empress Hotel. We had 2 one bedroom suites over a 4 day period. We all loved the location of the hotel, the rooms were very comfortable, hotel staff was most helpful. We would definately stay here again.
reviews.title: Very pleased

reviews.text: We stayed at the Empress two nights (10/2 and 10/3). After arriving very late we were helped to our room by the friendly night manager. Breakfast was nothing special but it did help you to get going. The crib for our son was in the room when we arrived. The room was clean and spacious, more than the Hampton Inn Del Mar which was the same price. Staff was friendly overall and I would stay there again in a heartbeat. Great location, although finding a place to dine with our 8 month old son was a bit intimidating as not many of the restaurants appeared child friendly.
reviews.title: Great Option in Expensive La Jolla

reviews.text: We waited too late to book a hotel for our la jolla surf camp vacation. I ended up calling the Empress directly and they gave me a better rate than AAA or the web. I was very impressed with the attentiveness of the staff. I was a mom traveling alone with three kids, everyone from the valet parking to the front desk went out of their way to make our stay pleasant and smooth. They recommended restaurants, loaned the kids surfer magazines and always welcomed us back with huge smiles. I would highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Perfect for mom traveling alone with kids
Great Hotel, Great Location!
reviews.text: The Empress Hotel of La Jolla is a very nice hotel; we paid $238.21 a night (not bad for La Jolla and the location). The room was very nice and the bed was extremely comfortable! The Hotel had a decent breakfast in the morning (and cookies in the lobby in the afternoon). The Hotel is within walking distance of most of the shops, restaurants, and the beach. The Hotel does not offer free parking, but valet is only $10.00. My only recommendation for this hotel is to request a room on any floor except the first floor...we were on the first floor and our very large windows were feet away from a busy sidewalk (see picture) so we did not feel like we could really keep our curtains open (this is the only reason the Hotel is not getting an "excellent" rating). Otherwise, the Hotel was great!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay was unbelievable! We choose the Empress Hotel because it was not large, and was unique. We booked the hotel for 2 nights and 3 days for my husband's birthday. The hotel exterior was fabulous for the time period of architecture. The lobby was classical and inviting. Now here is the big thing, the staff was friendly, sincere, and had a wonderful sense of humor! We loved the staff!!!! We were assigned Room 414 and when we walked in we felt at home. The room had a wonderful sitting area for hanging out and reading. The bed was extremely comfortable!!! Tons of pillows, great quality linens, and the bed felt brand new. We never sleep in when we stay anywhere, but at the Empress Hotel we didn't want to get out of this bed! The bathroom had granite countertops, and marble tiles in the bath tub/shower, very classy touch. We went to the Manhattan for cocktails and to listen to the jazz music of "Joe", which was a great treat. We did not have the opportunity to eat at the hotel, but the staff at the bar and walking in and out of the area were wonderful! We definitely will stay at the Empress Hotel everytime we go to La Jolla, as there is no other choice for us.
reviews.title: Exquisite!

reviews.text: We are a family of 4 and stayed at the Empress 3 nights in early August.. The room was nice and spacious and the bathrooms clean. They have apples at the reception desk which is a nice/healthful touch.......I didn't have a good nights rest as you could hear nothing but the opening and closing of doors all morning long. ( And I was wearing earplugs). We are not early raisers but might as well have been because you won't be sleeping in at this hotel. The first day we didn't need service. However the next day asked for maid service via the door tag. When we returrned. The bed was made but the pillows were still all over the floor. The maid did not leave any shampoo which my daughters discovered as they were in the shower. I called down twice they never came to the door with shampoo. I had to send my husband down to the lobby desk to retrieve the shampoo and conditioner all the while my daughters were in still in the shower shivering cold just waiting for them to bring the shampoo and conditioner up......Everytime you need your car you have to call down to the reception so they can retrieve you car for you.The vallet parkers were very pleasat. Not having the car accessable was not that big of a deal for us...Unfortunately, we won't be staying at this hotel again.....
reviews.title: Disapointed!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband & I stayed at the Empress for 3 nights in mid-June. The staff were pleasant but I was not told about cookies in the lobby(no big deal).The first room we entered smelled smoke so I called the desk & they changed our room.After reading another review about the same problem I think the staff should pay more attention to what's happening at their smoke-free hotel.We did enjoy the patio one afternoon by ourselves without any smoke blowing in our faces.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They were really quick about bringing the car over when we needed it.Our King room was a good size and it was clean.If you'd like something for breakfast besides what they offer here, I definitely reccomend The Cottage right at the corner.Food was delicious & wait staff friendly.
reviews.title: Fabulous Hotel

reviews.text: Great location, friendly helpful staff, impeccable rooms, good continental breakfast on sundeck, free internet, delicious cookies in the lobby. This charming hotel in LaJolla Village lacks nothing. Ben is a great asset to the front desk!
reviews.title: What a gem of a hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Marsha & Dave from Boston
reviews.title: Comfortable, affordable stay in La Jolla village

reviews.text: Staged a destination wedding in La Jolla, The Empress Hotel provided the perfect setting for all of our guests. They were able to enjoy the city by foot due to its convenient location. The hotel staff couldn't have been kinder and answered all our questions concerning food, entertainment, and sightseeing.
reviews.title: This is a great little hotel!

description: The Empress Hotel is a traditionally elegant European-style boutique hotel, known for its warm hospitality, superior accommodations and attentive service. Located right in the heart of La Jolla Village. Within walking distance to shops, restaurants, beach, and wedding sites. All guestrooms include complimentary deluxe continental breakfast and wireless internet.
